mpTxtNumCopy.Description: Copies the selected text or block with an attribute containing a numeric value, changing the value to a specified numerical step
mpTxtNumCopy.FullDescription: Copies the selected single line or multiline text, a block with an attribute or a multileader containing a digital value, with a value change to a specified numerical step. There are various settings – adding a prefix/suffix, suppressing tail zeros, etc.
mpTxtNumCopy.msg1: Select text, block with attributes or a multileader:
mpTxtNumCopy.msg3: Selected block does not contain attributes
mpTxtNumCopy.msg4: Selected text does not contain numeric values
mpTxtNumCopy.msg10: Selected multileader does not contain text
mpTxtNumCopy.h6: Save text BEFORE and text AFTER
mpTxtNumCopy.h8: Adding zeros to the beginning of a number
mpTxtNumCopy.h10: Removal from number all tail zeros
mpTxtNumCopy.h19: Separator of the integer and fractional part

mpMultiCopy.Description: Multiple copies of selected primitives with a certain step
mpMultiCopy.FullDescription:
Plugin supports two types of copying:
markup – copies primitives with a specified distance between them along the specified line;
divide – copies primitives by dividing the specified line by the number of segments entered.
There is a possibility to select an entity (line, polyline, spline) to set the copy path.
mpMultiCopy.msg3: Enter the number of segments or [Mark]
mpMultiCopy.msg5: Select a line, a polyline, or a spline:

mpTxtCenter.Description: Plugin allows you to create a single line text or align the existing one in the middle between two specified points

mpStandards.Description: Plugin allows you to create, store and add layer sets, text styles, dimensional styles and multileader styles
mpStandards.h2: Enter the name of the set
mpStandards.h18: Standard set of ModPlus layers. Can not delete
mpStandards.h19: Create a new set of layers
mpStandards.h20: Edit (view) the selected set of layers

mpStandards.h42: Auto-load standards when opening a drawing
mpStandards.h43: Copying standards from a file when creating a drawing
mpStandards.h44: Copying standards from a file when opening a drawing

mpStandards.h55: Specify the location to create the xml-file
mpStandards.h56: Specify the xml-file to import standards

mpMultiScale.Description: Plugin allows you to scale each of the selected objects relative to themselves
mpMultiScale.FullDescription: Each selected entity will be scaled relative to the specified point – Left Bottom, Right Bottom, Left Top, Right Top or Center. The scale point is determined by the rectangle describing the entity (Bounding Box)

mpMultiRotate.Description: Plugin allows you to rotate each of the selected entities relative to the Z-axis with the center of rotation relative to themselves
mpMultiRotate.FullDescription: Each selected entity will be rotated relative to the Z-axis with the center at a specified point – Left Bottom, Right Bottom, Left Top, Right Top or Center. The center of rotation is determined by the rectangle that describes the entity (Bounding Box)

mpMultiMirror.Description: Plugin allows to mirror each of the selected entities vertically or horizontally in relation to themselves
mpMultiMirror.FullDescription: Each selected entity will be mirrored vertically or horizontally with respect to a line passing through a specified point – Left Bottom, Right Bottom, Left Top, Right Top or Center. The point is determined by the rectangle that describes the entity (Bounding Box)

mpRotAtt.Description: Plugin is used to change the rotation angle of attributes in the selected blocks

mpLayerAuto.Description: Plugin is used to automatically add a layer to the created objects
mpLayerAuto.FullDescription: Plugin processes the creation, copying, pasting and other commands when working with AutoCAD objects – dimensions, text, multileaders, hatching, tables, viewports, lines, polylines, xLines, rays, circles, ellipses, splines, arcs, blocks – and sets the layer specified in the plugin settings for them. There is an option to specify the specified layers for the selected objects. There is an opportunity to set block layers by name
mpLayerAuto.h3: Available in the full version of the plugin
mpLayerAuto.h12: The function of the plugin is based on the processing of the command completion event. However, not all commands create new objects and can also cause errors when working with this plugin. You can edit the list of excluding yourself
mpLayerAuto.h15: Remove a command from the list
mpLayerAuto.h21: Save the settings for the current drawing and close the window
mpLayerAuto.h25: The limited version is available to three positions
mpLayerAuto.h32: ModPlus: The object is moved to the layer:
mpLayerAuto.h44: Layer settings for blocks by name are not saved in the drawing, as layer settings for entities, but in a user configuration file
mpLayerAuto.h49: Save layer settings for blocks by name to xml-file
mpLayerAuto.h50: Load layer settings for blocks by names from xml-file
mpLayerAuto.h51: The selected file is not a file for storing layer settings for blocks by name

mpFormats.Description: Plugin of inserting in the drawing formats according to GOST 2.301-68/ISO 216
mpFormats.FullDescription: Formats are inserted in the form of a block with a special label in the extended data. A label in the extended data is required to define the formats with other plugins (for example, "Sheet Numbering"). Therefore, you should not insert the formats with standard means of inserting a block into AutoCAD. Plugin allows you to add title blocks to the format – for this you need to install and at least once started the plugin "Title blocks"
mpFormats.h30: Specify a dwg file as a logo
mpFormats.h32: Edit the list of user posts
mpFormats.h38: Length of the format (mm) x Height of the format (mm)
mpFormats.h47: If you uncheck the box, the scale of the format will correspond to the scale indicated in the main window of the plugin
mpFormats.h56: The sizes of formats at multiplicity more than 1 are taken by multiplication of the parties of a format with multiplicity 1 on size of multiplicity that corresponds to limiting deviations in table 3 (paragraph 6). When you check the box, the sizes of the formats will be taken in full accordance with table 2 (paragraph 5)
mpFormats.h81: The line thickness changes after the stamp is created. Changing the thickness of thin lines is done by processing the thickness of the lines of the original stamp, in which the default value of thin lines is "ByBlock"
mpFormats.h82: The line thickness changes after the stamp is created. Changing the thickness of thick lines is done by processing the thickness of the lines of the original stamp, in which the default value of thick lines is "0.40 mm"
mpFormats.err1: The configuration file is corrupt!\nRun the ModPlus Configurator
mpFormats.err3: Invalid characters in the layout name:
mpFormats.err4: The following characters are not allowed:
mpFormats.err5: No file with title blocks was found!\nRun the "Title blocks" plugin to unpack a dwg file with title blocks
mpFormats.err6: Length of the format is not entered
mpFormats.err7: Height of the format is not entered
mpFormats.err8: Length of the format must be at least 30 mm
mpFormats.err9: Height of the format should be not less than 15 mm
mpFormats.err10: A title block with a table style was not found in the title block file
mpFormats.err11: Run the "Title blocks" plugin to overwrite the title blocks file
mpFormats.err12: The title block does not correspond to the title block ModPlus! Invalid number of cells

mpNotes.h30: The selected text style is annotative. Consider the scale of the annotation
mpNotes.h41: User notes file is not found
mpNotes.h53: Not specified (or not created) file of user notes!

mpMeshes.Description: Selection and calculation of the mass of rebar according to normative documents
mpMeshes.h24: Number of longitudinal bars in mesh, pcs.
mpMeshes.h25: Break mesh width by the number of steps
mpMeshes.h35: Welded reinforcing mesh for reinforced concrete structures and products
mpMeshes.h36: Welded mesh for reinforced concrete structures
mpMeshes.h37: Issue 1. Meshes with working reinforcement diameter from 10 to 32 mm
mpMeshes.h40: (From 850 to the length of the roll)
mpMeshes.h41: (From 3950 to the length of the roll)
mpMeshes.h44: The ratio of the smaller bar diameter to the larger should be at least 0.25
mpMeshes.h45: The value of the output of the reinforcement must be a multiple of 25
mpMeshes.h46: The output value should be 25 mm. It is allowed to take from 30 to 200 mm a multiple of 5 mm
mpMeshes.h47: The output value should be 25 mm. It is allowed to take from 15,20 and 30 mm, and also from 25 to 100 mm multiples of 25 mm
mpMeshes.h48: The additional step of longitudinal bars in heavy meshes is not allowed!
mpMeshes.h49: The additional step of the longitudinal bars in the light meshes should be from 50 mm to the size of the main step
mpMeshes.h51: The additional step of the transverse bars in heavy type 1 meshes should be 100, 200 or 300 mm!
mpMeshes.h52: The additional step of the transverse bars in heavy meshes of type 2,3 is not allowed!
mpMeshes.h53: The additional step of the transverse bars in the light meshes should be from 50 to 250 mm in multiples of 10 mm!
mpMeshes.h54: Not all data is entered correctly! Continue?
mpMeshes.h60: The width of mesh must be at least
mpMeshes.h61: The width of mesh should be no more than
mpMeshes.h62: The length of mesh must be at least
mpMeshes.h63: The length of mesh should be no more than

mpTables.Description: Plugin of inserting AutoCAD tables into the drawing according to GOST/DSTU/STB or from the specified file
mpTables.h12: Brief description (reference to the table in the normative document)
mpTables.h14: You can zoom the image using the mouse wheel, pan while holding down the left mouse button and fit the image by pressing the right mouse button

mpTables.h17: Inserting a table with Top-right binding

mpDimJustif.msg1: Select dimensions for alignment of extension lines
mpDimJustif.msg2: First point of the alignment line:
mpDimJustif.msg3: Select dimensions for alignment of dimension lines
mpDimJustif.msg4: Second point of the alignment line:

mpStamps.Description: Plugin of inserting title blocks in the drawing (as AutoCAD tables) according to normative documentation, with field support
mpStamps.FullDescription: Using the "Field" plugin allows you to add additional values to the document that you can insert into the title block in the form of fields. This allows you to change the values in the title block at once in all the title blocks throughout the document
mpStamps.h12: Brief description (reference to the title block in the normative document)
mpStamps.h14: Inserting a title block with Top-left binding
mpStamps.h15: Inserting a title block with Top-right binding
mpStamps.h16: Inserting a title block with Bottom-left binding
mpStamps.h17: Inserting a title block with Bottom-right binding
mpStamps.h28: Specify a dwg file as a logo
mpStamps.h32: Edit the list of user posts
mpStamps.h39: The height of the text in all cells of the title block. The default is 2.5, which corresponds to ESKD GOST 2.304-81 "Drawing fonts"
mpStamps.h40: Additional text height. It is installed in such cells as "Document designation", "Stage", "Sheet", etc., which gives the title block expressiveness and readability. The default is 3.5, which corresponds to ESKD GOST 2.304-81 "Drawing fonts"
mpStamps.h41: Specify the block defined in this drawing to insert it into the title block as a logo
mpStamps.h42: The specified dwg-file will be added to the current drawing in the form of a block, which will be inserted into the title block as a logo. The file name will be the file name. If a block with this name already exists in the current drawing, the block from the drawing will be used
mpStamps.h62: Add completed fields to the drawing
mpStamps.h64: Load and set the field values from the specified dwg file
mpStamps.h71: Get the value from the drawing
mpStamps.h75: You can use line breaks in boxes 2,3 and 9. To add line breaks use Enter
mpStamps.h77: Date is added if there is a surname in the line
mpStamps.h78: The width factor for the field that is inserted into the stamp. The width factor will be applied directly to the inserted field, regardless of the width factor set in the text style. Valid values are from 0.01 to 100.0. In order not to change the width factor, specify the value 0
mpStamps.h81: The line thickness changes after the stamp is created. Changing the thickness of thin lines is done by processing the thickness of the lines of the original stamp, in which the default value of thin lines is "ByBlock"
mpStamps.h82: The line thickness changes after the stamp is created. Changing the thickness of thick lines is done by processing the thickness of the lines of the original stamp, in which the default value of thick lines is "0.40 mm"
mpStamps.h87: Enabling or disabling the use of signature
mpStamps.h92: The specified file was not found!
mpStamps.h99: The signature is inserted in the lower left corner of the cell to the right of the cell with the surname. The scale of tables (title blocks) is not taken into account!
mpStamps.h101: Copy layout name into the title block
mpStamps.h102: You can zoom the image using the mouse wheel, pan while holding down the left mouse button and fit the image by pressing the right mouse button

mpSummLength.Description: Gets and displays the number and sum of the lengths of selected lines, polylines, circles, arcs and splines
mpSummLength.h6: Insert result as a single line text
mpSummLength.h7: Insert result into a table cell
mpSummLength.h8: Export result to a txt file

mpSelSim.Description: Plugins allow you to select objects that are similar to sample objects from all objects in the drawing, or from a specific set
mpSelSim.FullDescription: Before using the plugin, you need to configure the conditions by which similar objects will be searched for – the same type, the same layer, the same color, etc. For some types, there are additional matching conditions. For example, the same text heights, blocks with the same name, etc.
mpSelSim.h3: Add sample objects to the final set (select similar from the selected)
mpSelSim.h22: With the same contents of the text
mpSelSim.h25: With the same number of characters
mpSelSim.h39: With the same value of any attribute
mpSelSim.h40: With the same value of all attributes
mpSelSim.msg3: Select objects to delete from the set or
mpSelSim.msg4: Select objects among which to search for analogues:
mpSelSim.msg5: Select the objects to be removed from the set:

mpHandDim.Description: Color highlight, restore or delete dimensions with an override value

mpCalc.Description: It is an analog of a standard calculator, with the ability to retrieve data from a drawing, adding a result to a drawing, and the ability to manually write a formula for calculating
mpCalc.mi1: Absolute value of the specified number
mpCalc.mi2: The angle whose cosine is equal to the specified number
mpCalc.mi3: The angle whose sine is equal to the specified number
mpCalc.mi4: Angle, the tangent of which is equal to the specified number
mpCalc.mi5: The smallest integer is greater than or equal to a given number
mpCalc.mi6: E, raised to the specified degree
mpCalc.mi7: The largest integer is less than or equal to a given number
mpCalc.mi8: The remainder of dividing the indicated number by another specified number
mpCalc.mi9: The logarithm of the specified number
mpCalc.mi10: Logarithm with base 10 of the specified number
mpCalc.mi11: The greater of the two numbers
mpCalc.mi12: The smaller of the two numbers
mpCalc.mi13: The specified number, raised to the specified degree
mpCalc.mi14: Rounds a value to the nearest integer or specified number of decimal places
mpCalc.mi15: The value that specifies the sign of a number
mpCalc.h10: A number of symbols after comma
mpCalc.h12: Measure the distance between two points
mpCalc.h13: Get the sum of lengths from entities
mpCalc.h38: Insert result as a single line text
mpCalc.h39: Insert result into existing single line text (with replacement)
mpCalc.h40: Insert result into a table cell
mpCalc.h51: Get the height of the 3D Solid

mpCalc.msg25: Select multiple 3D Solids that have the "Height" property

mpArmature.Description: Working with assortments of reinforcement – obtaining various information and calculations
mpArmature.FullDescription: Plugin requires plug-in databases. Plugin allows you to obtain various information and calculation data (area, weight, anchoring, etc.) for a large number of different assortments
mpArmature.h5: Selecting by diameter of the reinforcement
mpArmature.h7: Selection by cross-sectional area of the reinforcement
mpArmature.h9: Selection by weight of one running meter of reinforcement
mpArmature.h11: Selecting a class of steel reinforcement
mpArmature.h14: The field for entering the length (mm) for calculating the mass
mpArmature.h17: Measure the length between two points
mpArmature.h18: Get the sum of lengths from entities
mpArmature.h20: A number of symbols after comma
mpArmature.h22: Insert the result of the calculation in the AutoCAD table
mpArmature.h24: Insert the name of the selected reinforcement into the AutoCAD table
mpArmature.h26: Insert the result of the calculation and the name of the selected reinforcement in the AutoCAD table
mpArmature.h37: View of the surface of reinforcement
mpArmature.h38: Attention! The surface appearance of the reinforcement may depend on the class of reinforcement, diameter or other values that are not considered by the program. Read the normative documentation
mpArmature.h42: α is a coefficient that takes into account the effect on the anchoring length of the stress state of concrete and reinforcement and the structural solution of the element in the anchoring zone. When anchoring rods of a periodic profile with straight ends (straight anchoring) or smooth reinforcement with hooks or loops without additional anchoring devices for stretched rods, take α = 1.0, and for compressed ones – α = 0.75. According to clause 10.3.30 of SP 63.13330, the coefficient α may be increased to 2.0
mpArmature.h43: Required and actual reinforcement are equal
mpArmature.h45: By default, we accept that the required reinforcement and the actual installed reinforcement are equal. In case the reinforcement is different, select the actually installed reinforcement. The required reinforcement is selected in the left part of the window
mpArmature.h51: Document status: No information or legislation
mpArmature.h52: Calculation of the length of anchorage or overlap for the current diameter of the reinforcement is performed in a separate window
mpArmature.msg4: Allowed to enter only numbers and point
mpArmature.msg6: Mass of one meter to table

mpTxtCopyPaste.Description: Fast copying of single line or multiline text content, mleaders, dimensions or table cells
mpTxtCopyPaste.msg1: Select the source entity (text, mleader, table or dimension):
mpTxtCopyPaste.msg2: Select source entity (text, mleader, table or dimension) or [Delete]:

mpTxtCopyPaste.msg5: Select entity (text, mleader or table) to replace the content

mpRemoveAnnotScale.Description: Clears the list of annotative scales in the selected annotative objects, leaving the current scale

mpTotals.Description: Plugin for quickly creating Totals with the possibility of obtaining values from the drawing
mpTotals.FullDescription: Plugin collects data from tables inserted into the current document. The list of reference documents is collected according to the regulatory documents that are present in the plugin database
mpTotals.h6: If this option is enabled and the current document is saved, the shared data file (Drawing name_Totals.xml) will be automatically created in the current drawing location directory when the plugin starts
mpTotals.h16: Get Totals from model or specified layouts
mpTotals.h33: Formats from list (in form of blocks):
mpTotals.h35: Search in layouts is made on tables without taking into account the format! It is conventionally accepted that one layout corresponds to one format
mpTotals.h37: Tables are not saved to file! After closing, all data will be lost!\nAre you sure you want to close the window?

mpTotals.h61: You must select one or more drawings in the list of open drawings or set the checkbox "Search only in current drawing"
mpTotals.h64: There is modified data that can be written back

mpProductInsert.Description: Plugin of inserting products from the ModPlus database as blocks containing extended data
mpProductInsert.FullDescription: Plugin creates AutoCAD blocks based on data from the database. Extended data is added to the blocks, which allows processing these blocks with other plugins and creating a specification based on them\nPlugin also allows you to add extended data to ordinary AutoCAD entities\nImportant! Blocks must be inserted with this plugin or copy already inserted, otherwise (when inserted by normal means AutoCAD), extended data will not be added!
mpProductInsert.h1: Edit the list of documents used by the plugin
mpProductInsert.h24: Add masking to hide items behind the block
mpProductInsert.h26: Inserting a product in the form of a block with a simple geometry and with extended data
mpProductInsert.h30: Add to the specified entity extended data containing information about the product
mpProductInsert.h31: Show documents for the database section:
mpProductInsert.h39: The insertion options "By two points" and "In the form of polyline" are only available for linear products (products whose length is required). The insertion option will use if it is active and selected. When using either of the two options, you do not need to pre-specify the length of the product in the window. The "By two point" insert option is available when you select the "Side view" or "Top view" display option. The insertion option "In the form of polyline" is available when selecting the "Front view (section)" display option
mpProductInsert.msg2: The selected block does not contain the extended data of the ModPlus product\nReplace this block?
mpProductInsert.msg3: Select entities in which you want to add data for the product
mpProductInsert.msg4: Enter the length of the product
mpProductInsert.msg5: Enter the diameter of the product
mpProductInsert.msg6: Enter the width of the product
mpProductInsert.msg7: Enter the height of the product

mpDrawOrderByLayer.Description: Plugin serves to change the draworder according to the layers
mpDrawOrderByLayer.FullDescription: Plugin processes the layers marked with check marks in the window, changing the drawing order according to the order of the marked layers. There is a mode "Auto", which automatically changes the order of drawing objects on one of the two specified layers when creating or editing
mpDrawOrderByLayer.h13: Save the current position of layers in the drawing
mpDrawOrderByLayer.h14: Load and apply the layer position stored in the current drawing. Layers that have been added after the position is saved will be moved to the end of the list
mpDrawOrderByLayer.h15: Move the selected layer to the beginning of the list

mpDocTemplates.Description: Plugin allows you to create templates of the text part of the section according to "Resolution of the Russian Federation No.87" with the title page according to GOST R 21.1101-2013
mpDocTemplates.h13: Get data from fields (see plugin "Title blocks")
mpDocTemplates.h19: You did not specify any template to create

mpPrPosition.Description: Plugin adds/removes a position to the selected products and allows position marking of the item
mpPrPosition.h1: Select entities that are ModPlus products
mpPrPosition.h5: Select entities that are ModPlus products to delete a position
mpPrPosition.h6: Select the type of marking for the product

mpPrToTable.Description: Plugin allows you to fill the specification table with the selected ModPlus products
mpPrToTable.FullDescription: Plugin collects data for the specification from the extended product data (blocks created by the "Insert product" plugin, or AutoCAD primitives with the expanded data added by the "Insert product" plugin), as well as from blocks that have attributes for the specification. It is possible to specify a line from which the table will be populated
mpPrToTable.h1: Select entities that are ModPlus products
mpPrToTable.h4: Ask a row to start filling
mpPrToTable.h5: A number of symbols after comma
mpPrToTable.h7: Wrong choice! This is not a table!

mpDimBreak.Description: Break the selected dimension into two or more new
mpDimBreak.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to break the selected linear or parallel dimension into two or more dimensions by dynamically specifying a new point that will be common for the two new dimensions

mpBlkReplace.Description: Plugin allows to quickly replace blocks or entities in a drawing with a specified block
mpBlkReplace.FullDescription: Plugin works in three modes: Replace selected - allows to replace all selected blocks by one specified block; Replace similar - allows to replace all instances of one block by one specified block; Replace entities - allows to replace selected entities of Circle, Ellipse and Point types by one specified block. It allows to delete the description of the replaced block from the drawing base. Similar to the command "PURGE". Various settings are present
mpBlkReplace.h3: Select multiple blocks to replace them
mpBlkReplace.h5: Remove replaced blocks from the drawing database?
mpBlkReplace.h10: Transformation (mirror and rotation) of replaced block
mpBlkReplace.h18: Attributes with the same name of replaced block

mpPlinesEdit.Description: Collection of various plugins for working with polylines
mpPlinesEdit.h7: The ModPlus tab is not found
mpPlinesEdit.h8: The ModPlus tab was not found to add a work panel to polylines
mpPlinesEdit.h13: Divide the arc by an equal number of segments\nThe image shows a variant of dividing by 3 segments\nR is the arc radius in the polyline
mpPlinesEdit.h14: Divide the arc into segments by specifying the length of the arc segments resulting from the division\nR is the arc radius in the polyline\nL – length of the arc segment
mpPlinesEdit.h15: Divide the arc into segments by specifying the chord deviation (segment height)\nR is the arc radius in the polyline\nH – segment height
mpPlinesEdit.h16: Divide the arc into segments by specifying the length of the chord\nR is the arc radius in the polyline\nX – chord length
mpPlinesEdit.h22: P is the point of the polyline
mpPlinesEdit.h23: - Plugin works by checking both conditions
mpPlinesEdit.h24: H is the maximum deviation from the straight line:
mpPlinesEdit.cb5: by insertion point of the block
mpPlinesEdit.d1: Create copies of selected 3D polylines as LW-polylines (2D) with transfer to level 0.0
mpPlinesEdit.d2: Deleting adjacent vertices of selected polylines that have the same coordinates
mpPlinesEdit.l3: Removing vertices that lie on a straight line
mpPlinesEdit.d3: Deleting adjacent vertices of selected polyline, which lie on a straight line. It is possible to set tolerance for deviation from the straight or angular tolerance
mpPlinesEdit.l4: Placing an object at the vertices of a polyline
mpPlinesEdit.d4: Place the selected object in the vertices of the polyline. It is possible to rotate the object along the polyline segment. Blocks can be placed both on the geometric center, and on the insertion point
mpPlinesEdit.l5: Replacing an arc segment with linear
mpPlinesEdit.d5: Replacing the specified arc segment of the polyline with a linear
mpPlinesEdit.l6: Replacing an linear segment with arc
mpPlinesEdit.d6: Replacing the specified linear (or arc) segment of the polyline with an arc. It is possible to construct an arc along a tangent or a point on an arc
mpPlinesEdit.d7: Dynamically adding a vertex to the specified polyline
mpPlinesEdit.l8: Drawing a rectangle by three points
mpPlinesEdit.l9: Removing Arc Segments from a Polyline
mpPlinesEdit.d9: Remove polyline arc segments by replacing them with linear segments. There are several options for the plugin: the number of segments, the length of segments, the height of segments (chord deviation), the length of the chord
mpPlinesEdit.d10: The construction of a middle line (as polyline) between two specified curves (segments, polylines or splines)
mpPlinesEdit.k8: The maximum deviation from the straight line (H) is accepted
mpPlinesEdit.k12: does not contain vertices lying on a straight line or suitable under the conditions of tolerance
mpPlinesEdit.k15: Select an arc segment of the polyline
mpPlinesEdit.k17: Specify a point on the tangent or: [Tangent/traverse Point]
mpPlinesEdit.k18: Specify a point on the arc or: [Tangent/traverse Point]
mpPlinesEdit.k19: Specify the point (hold Ctrl to move the vertex forward)
mpPlinesEdit.k24: Enter the length of the segment
mpPlinesEdit.k26: Enter the length of the chord
mpPlinesEdit.k27: Select first support element (line, polyline or spline)
mpPlinesEdit.k28: Select second support element (line, polyline or spline)
mpPlinesEdit.k30: Simplify the polyline?\nThe points on the same straight line will be deleted

mpSpecifications.Description: Plugin for the formation and filling of general specifications
mpSpecifications.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to add items to the context menu of AutoCAD, allowing you to expand the ability to work with the specifications: Context menu for tables: Add product from the database – allows you to add products from the plugin database directly into the AutoCAD table; Context menu for blocks: Add/change attributes for the specification – allows you to add attributes to the blocks for the specification (see details in the help)
mpSpecifications.h7: Available in the full version of the plugin
mpSpecifications.h21: Add a new item. The item is added one line lower than the currently selected line in the specification. If nothing is selected in the specification, then the item is inserted at the end of the specification
mpSpecifications.h23: Add selected products from the drawing to the specification
mpSpecifications.h30: Select from the list or write
mpSpecifications.h31: Show documents for the database section:
mpSpecifications.h37: Enter a name for the specification
mpSpecifications.h38: For this drawing there is already a specification with this name!
mpSpecifications.h48: Edit the list of documents used by the plugin
mpSpecifications.k1: The current specification is not saved! Data will be lost!\nAre you sure you want to exit the plugin?
mpSpecifications.k2: Select entities that are ModPlus products
mpSpecifications.k5: An error occurred while generating the key for the current drawing
mpSpecifications.k6: The current specification is not saved and will be lost irrevocably!\nContinue?
mpSpecifications.k7: The specification will be permanently deleted!\nContinue?
mpSpecifications.k8: There is no file with tables! You need to run the "Tables" plugin to create it
mpSpecifications.k9: Could not copy table from resource file
mpSpecifications.k10: The file is created by the plugin "Specification" (mpSpecifications), which is part of the ModPlus plugin.\nDO NOT change this file manually. This can lead to errors in the plugin!
mpSpecifications.msg1: Enter the length of the product
mpSpecifications.msg2: Enter the diameter of the product
mpSpecifications.msg3: Enter the width of the product
mpSpecifications.msg4: Enter the height of the product

mpSheetNumbers.Description: Plugin for setting the sheet number in the document and in the volume in ModPlus format and title blocks
mpSheetNumbers.FullDescription: Plugin works in models and in sheets. First you need to get data that is read from the title blocks and formats of the ModPlus plugin. After specifying new data, you just need to apply the changes
mpSheetNumbers.h8: All "Number in document" values will be automatically numbered from this cell. An integer must be entered in the cell
mpSheetNumbers.h10: All "Number in volume" values will be automatically numbered from this cell. An integer must be entered in the cell
mpSheetNumbers.h14: You need to go to the "Model" tab
mpSheetNumbers.h24: You must enter an integer in the "Number in document"
mpSheetNumbers.h25: You must enter an integer in the "Number in volume"
mpSheetNumbers.d2: Left to right and top to bottom
mpSheetNumbers.d3: Left to right and bottom to top
mpSheetNumbers.d4: Right to left and top to bottom
mpSheetNumbers.d5: Right to left and bottom to top

mpDwgBase.Description: Base of various blocks and drawings
mpDwgBase.FullDescription: The dwg database allows you to insert both blocks and finished drawings (for example, details view). The dwg database is filled with users. Plugin requires access to the internet
mpDwgBase.h1: Sending user blocks and drawings to the modplus.org server
mpDwgBase.h10: Add a new item to the local database
mpDwgBase.h11: Auxiliary methods for managing the user base
mpDwgBase.h15: You can scale and pan the image with the mouse wheel

mpDwgBase.r1: The default plugin assumes that the blocks added to the local (user) database will be added to the global database that is available to all users.
mpDwgBase.r2: Therefore, try to follow the recommendations:
mpDwgBase.r3: The added block should be useful in the work. No matter what professional orientation it will be
mpDwgBase.r4: Do not use a wide variety of layers in the blocks, if this is not necessary. The best option is to use the standard layers of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r5: If the block is dynamic, then perhaps it is not necessary to add attributes for the specification
mpDwgBase.r6: Let the blocks understandable names and descriptions, so that the user does not have to guess what it is and why
mpDwgBase.r7: If you took a block from some resource, then be sure to specify the source!
mpDwgBase.r8: Do not be lazy to think over the path to the block in the database
mpDwgBase.r10: The default plugin assumes that the drawings added to the local (user) database will be added to the global database, which is accessible to all users.
mpDwgBase.r11: Therefore, some restrictions are added to the attached drawings:
mpDwgBase.r13: In the attached drawing, Proxy primitives should not be used
mpDwgBase.r14: Drawings made in poor quality (for example, with multileaders from lines and text, etc.) will not be taken to the public database
mpDwgBase.r15: Also try to follow the recommendations:
mpDwgBase.r16: Do not use a wide variety of layers in the drawings, if this is not necessary. The best option is to use the standard layers of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r17: Do not use a large number of annotation styles in your drawings. The best option is to use the annotations styles of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r18: Do not use line types in drawings that are not standard for AutoCAD
mpDwgBase.r19: Do not use fonts that are not part of the standard AutoCAD font set in drawings
mpDwgBase.r20: If you took a drawing from some resource, then be sure to specify the source!
mpDwgBase.r21: Do not be lazy to think over the way to the drawing in the database
mpDwgBase.pp1: It is assumed that you have selected a block in a file that is not yet located in the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase directory. Therefore, you must either specify a file previously created in the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase directory to place blocks in it, or create this file. The selected block will be copied to the specified file.
mpDwgBase.pp2: If you add several blocks with a common orientation (for example, blocks of floor slabs), then create one file for them. You do not need to create a separate file for each block!
mpDwgBase.pp3: Files in the root of the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase folder can not be created! Create subfolders in it (for example, ModPlus/Data/DwgBase/Floor slabs).
mpDwgBase.pp4: If you created a file with blocks, put it in the folder DwgBase and now add blocks from the file to the database, check the "Current file" check box.
mpDwgBase.pp5: The field is filled in according to your wish
mpDwgBase.pp6: P.S. We are very happy for you, if you have an original and beautiful Nick, but try all the same to write Surname and First Name
mpDwgBase.pp7: If you are not the author of the block, then indicate the source from where this block was taken, so as not to offend its creator
mpDwgBase.pp8: The conditional path to the block in the directory that forms the structure of the tree
mpDwgBase.pp9: For example, the path "Блоки/Каталог1/Каталог2/Каталог3" will yield the following result:
mpDwgBase.pp10: Each conditional sub directory must be separated by a "/"
mpDwgBase.pp11: Adding attributes for the specifications to the block
mpDwgBase.pp12: Attributes will be added to the block when it is inserted by this plugin.
mpDwgBase.pp13: All attributes will be invisible. You can change their value in the block properties after inserting.
mpDwgBase.pp14: You can fill in the default values.
mpDwgBase.pp16: Specify the default values for the attributes. These values will be added to the block when it is inserted.
mpDwgBase.pp17: By default, the values of the attributes that were set as the "default value" when the attribute is created are populated. You can fill the attribute values with the values of the currently selected block.
mpDwgBase.pp19: To add to the database, the file must be saved in AutoCAD 2013 version!
mpDwgBase.pp20: If you have already located the file in the subfolder of the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase folder, then you can "Select" it.
mpDwgBase.pp21: If the drawing file is not located in the subfolder of the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase folder, then you can "Copy" it to it.
mpDwgBase.pp22: If you are adding an open drawing currently located in the subfolder of the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase folder, check the "Current file" check box.
mpDwgBase.pp23: The name of the drawing that is displayed in the plugin window
mpDwgBase.pp25: Who added the drawing to the dwg database
mpDwgBase.pp26: If you are not the author of the drawing, then indicate the source from where this drawing was taken, so as not to offend its creator
mpDwgBase.pp27: The conditional path to the drawing in the directory that forms the structure of the tree
mpDwgBase.u1: UTILITIES OF THE DWG USER BASE
mpDwgBase.u8: Select several elements in the list (check the boxes) for which you want to change the "Path" in the database. Specify a new value for "Path" and click "Apply"

mpDwgBase.u14: Select several elements in the list (check the boxes) for which you want to change "Source" and "Added by". Specify a new value for "Source" and "Added by" and click "Apply" (Leave the field blank if you do not want to change the value)
mpDwgBase.u15: Unused files are files located in the directory
mpDwgBase.u16: that are not referenced by any element in databases (plug-in base and user database)
mpDwgBase.u19: Also, images for these files and .bak files will be deleted
mpDwgBase.u20: Elements without a source file are elements in the user database that reference a non-existent source file

mpESKD.Description: Create smart objects that extend the capabilities of AutoCAD, as well as allow to perform design according to state standards (ISO)
mpESKD.tab5: Working with styles and settings of ModPlus smart entities
mpESKD.tab13: Search for smart entities by type
mpESKD.tab14: Search for smart entities by the value of string and numeric properties
mpESKD.tab18: Find and replace in smart objects by value of string and numeric properties
mpESKD.err5: Error getting data from the registry! Run the Configurator to update the data in the registry
mpESKD.msg3: Select a block that is an ModPlus smart entity
mpESKD.msg10: smart entities of the specified types are not found in the current space
mpESKD.msg13: Specify the position point of the Level Mark:
mpESKD.msg20: Specify the point of a text indent:
mpESKD.h7: Maximum limit of the selected objects
mpESKD.h8: can be changed in the plugin
mpESKD.h18: Set the selected style as the default style
mpESKD.h19: Create a new style based on the selected smart entity
mpESKD.h22: When creating an entity, set the scale from the style
mpESKD.h23: If checked, then when creating the smart entity, the scale will be applied to it, set in the current style, regardless of the annotative scale of the drawing. Otherwise, the annotative scale of the drawing will be applied to the entity
mpESKD.h24: When creating an entity, set the layer from the style
mpESKD.h25: If checked, then when creating the smart entity, it will be applied layer, installed in the current style, regardless of the current layer of the drawing. Otherwise, the current layer of the drawing will be applied to the entity
mpESKD.h26: If there is no layer in the current document specified in the style:
mpESKD.h28: When you create a smart entity, the current drawing layer is applied to it
mpESKD.h29: Create and apply a layer from the style
mpESKD.h30: In the current document, a layer set in style will be created and applied to the smart entity
mpESKD.h31: When creating an entity, set the text style from the style
mpESKD.h32: If checked, then when you create the smart entity, a text style will be applied to it, set in the current style, regardless of the current text style of the drawing. Otherwise, the current text style of the drawing will be applied to the entity
mpESKD.h33: If there is no text style specified in the style in the current document:
mpESKD.h35: When creating an smart entity, the current text style of the drawing will be applied to it
mpESKD.h36: Create and apply a text style from the style
mpESKD.h37: In the current document, a text style will be created and applied to the entity, set in style
mpESKD.h38: The maximum limit of the selected entities when the property palette stops working. This setting is needed to speed up the work in the AutoCAD environment by disabling the reading of object properties. For example, if you need to select 1000 objects to copy to another drawing, then processing the properties of all these objects is not necessary
mpESKD.h39: Maximum limit of the selected entities (0 – always work):
mpESKD.h42: Change the scale of the line type in proportion to the scale of the entity
mpESKD.h43: The scale of the line type that is set for the axis will vary in proportion to the basic scale of the axis. For example, if you set the axis scale to 1:1 and scale the line type to 2, then if you set the axis scale to 1:100, the line type scale becomes 200
mpESKD.h45: When creating axes, there will be search for already created axes in the drawing and collect their values from the first axis marker, followed by sorting the values in ascending order. For the created axis, the axis marker value will be set next from the last found value
mpESKD.h47: When you select a Level Mark, auxiliary lines from the base point to the level point and from the level point to the level mark will be shown
mpESKD.h57: Creation of an smart entity on the basis of an anonymous block describing the line of the break, by specifying two points
mpESKD.h62: Creating an smart entity based on an anonymous block describing a curvilinear break, by specifying two points
mpESKD.h63: Creating an smart entity based on an anonymous block describing a cylindrical break, by specifying two points
mpESKD.h66: Creating an smart entity based on an anonymous block describing the straight axis, by specifying two points

For the created fragment will be set to the value of the fragment number following from the last value found

mpESKD.h180: When creating chain leaders, there will be a search for already created leaders in the drawing and collection of their values, and then sorting the values in ascending order. The value of the number or letter next to the last found value will be set for the created leader. The function works only if all created chain leaders have numeric or alphabetic values

mpESKD.h196: Basic style for marking the concreting joint
mpESKD.h199: Creating an smart entity based on an anonymous block describing the node designation
mpESKD.h201: Continue the values of the node designations being created
mpESKD.h202: When creating node designations, there will be a search for already created node designations in the drawing and collecting their node number values, followed by sorting the values in ascending order. For the created node designation, the value of the node number next from the last found value will be set
mpESKD.h205: Creating an smart entity based on an anonymous block describing the revision mark
mpESKD.h210: Creating an smart entity based on an anonymous block describing the crested leader
mpESKD.h214: Creating an smart entity based on an anonymous block describing the pile mark
mpESKD.h217: Creating an smart entity based on an anonymous block describing the dip mark
mpESKD.sot0: All found smart entities will have graphics regeneration
mpESKD.sot1: All smart entities of the specified types in the current space will be selected
mpESKD.sot2: All smart entities of the specified types in the current space will delete the extended data, which will turn the entities into ordinary blocks
mpESKD.sot3: All smart entities of the specified types in the current space will be explode
mpESKD.sot4: All smart entities of the specified types in the current space will be delete
mpESKD.glfst2: Half the distance between groups of strokes
mpESKD.glfst3: The distance between groups of strokes
mpESKD.wjt1: Butt factory solid on the visible side
mpESKD.wjt2: Butt factory solid on the invisible side
mpESKD.wjt3: Butt mounting solid from the visible side
mpESKD.wjt4: Butt mounting solid from the invisible side
mpESKD.wjt5: Butt factory intermittent on the visible side
mpESKD.wjt6: Butt factory intermittent on the invisible side
mpESKD.wjt7: Butt mounting intermittent from the visible side
mpESKD.wjt8: Butt mounting intermittent from the invisible side
mpESKD.wjt9: Corner factory solid on the visible side
mpESKD.wjt10: Corner factory solid on the invisible side
mpESKD.wjt11: Corner mounting solid from the visible side
mpESKD.wjt12: Corner mounting solid from the invisible side
mpESKD.wjt13: Corner factory intermittent on the visible side
mpESKD.wjt14: Corner factory intermittent on the invisible side
mpESKD.wjt15: Corner mounting intermittent from the visible side
mpESKD.wjt16: Corner mounting intermittent on the invisible side
mpESKD.d1: BreakLine type: linear, curved or cylindrical
mpESKD.d2: For linear break value of the projection is specified in mm For curved break the value of the projection is specified in % of the length between the main points. For cylindrical break value of the projection is not being used
mpESKD.d3: Break width in mm. Only for linear type BreakLine
mpESKD.d4: Break height in mm. Only for linear type BreakLine
mpESKD.d6: The scale of the linetype specified in the properties of block
mpESKD.d8: Position of markers: from two sides, from above or from below
mpESKD.d16-2: Offset of top or bottom axis fracture
mpESKD.d17: Text style for axis text elements
mpESKD.d18: Text height of axis text elements
mpESKD.d32: Visibility of the bottom orient marker
mpESKD.d33: Visibility of the top orient marker
mpESKD.d36: Indent the first stroke in each segment of the ground line
mpESKD.d36-1: Indent the first stroke in each segment of the waterproofing line
mpESKD.d42: The length of the middle stroke to the point of fracture
mpESKD.d44: The length of the main strokes of the section
mpESKD.d45: Shelf indent along the stroke in percent
mpESKD.d54: Sheet number position: on both sides, bottom, top
mpESKD.d55: Whether to draw a line from the Level Mark to the measurement object
mpESKD.d56: Offset of the object line from the measurement object
mpESKD.d57: The length of the bottom shelf from the edge of the shelf from the side of the measurement object to the arrow of the Level mark
mpESKD.d58: Ledge of the bottom shelf from the Level Mark arrow to the edge of the shelf on the opposite side of the measurement object
mpESKD.d63: Shelf ledge relative to the longest text
mpESKD.d63-1: Shelf overhang relative to the text
mpESKD.d64: Show plus if the measured value is greater than zero. This property is ignored if the text is redefined
mpESKD.d67: Accuracy of the measured value. Sets the number of decimal places
mpESKD.d69: Sets a value in the range from 0.000001 to 1000000 by which the distance measured in the drawing is multiplied
mpESKD.d72: Separator for integer and fractional parts of a number
mpESKD.d75: Adding an asterisk at the end of the main value
mpESKD.d83: Corner radius of the rectangular frame
mpESKD.d83-1: Corner radius of the fragment mark
mpESKD.d84: Leader with text will maintain a horizontal position after rotating the object with the "Rotate" command
mpESKD.d85: Adding wipeout along the text outline with a specified offset. The display of frames for wipeouts is controlled by the WIPEOUTFRAME and FRAME system variables.
mpESKD.d85-1: Adding wipeout along the text outline with a specified offset. The display of frames for wipeouts is controlled by the WIPEOUTFRAME and FRAME system variables. If rectangular frame is set, then the wipeout is created along the frame without taking into account the offset
mpESKD.d86: Wipeout offset is considered for frame types "Line" and "No frame"
mpESKD.d87: Presence of arrows: on both sides, a first or second
mpESKD.d105: Line type generation along the whole polyline
mpESKD.d107: The line formula is given by integers separated by hyphens. Each odd number (1, 3, 5, ...) specifies the stroke length. Each even number (2, 4, 6, ...) specifies a space length
mpESKD.p117: Line length at the left edge
mpESKD.d117: Line length at the left edge of the joint line segment
mpESKD.d118: Visibility at lines on the edges of joint line segments
mpESKD.d122: Vertical offset of small text from the line
mpESKD.d156: Display the taper symbol instead of the slope symbol
mpESKD.d157: Take the leftmost of the two points as the first point when calculating the slope

mpStripMtext.Description: Remove specified formatting from multiline text
mpStripMtext.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to delete the formatting of multiline text, mleaders, dimensions, attributes of blocks and tables
mpStripMtext.h1: Select type of formatting to remove
mpStripMtext.st1: Remove vertical alignment. Vertical alignment appears when there are fractions in the text
mpStripMtext.st14: Convert stacking text to line text

mpRevitSheetsMerging.Description: Merging files from Revit exports into one drawing. The plugin must be run in an empty drawing. The plugin processes files exported with the "Export views on sheets and links as external references" checkbox disabled
mpRevitSheetsMerging.h2: Error importing sheets from a file
mpRevitSheetsMerging.h5: Lock the viewports on the imported sheets?

mpAppendText.Description: Appending text to multileader, single-line text, multiline text, dimensions

mpSumArea.Description: Gets and displays the number and sum of areas of selected polylines, circles, arcs, splines and hatches
mpSumArea.h6: Insert the result as a single-line text
mpSumArea.h7: Insert the result into a table cell
